```{r warning=FALSE}
# install.packages('UsingR') 
library(UsingR) 
data(normtemp)
```
1. Use the normtemp dataset to answer the following: 
	a. Determine the following statistics for the variable temperature:
	
		Minimum: 96.30
		
		Maximum: 100.80
		
		Mean: 98.25
		
		Standard Deviation: 0.7331832
```{r}
summary(normtemp)
sd(normtemp$temperature)
```
b. Does temperature appear to be normally distributed?

  Yes, the distribution of temperature looks to be Normally distributed visually.
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# install.packages("ggpubr")
library(ggpubr)
gghistogram(normtemp$temperature) # Use ggpubr gghistogram to speed up graph making
ggqqplot(normtemp$temperature)
```
